what: Finding Children with Unusual Growth Patterns
title: Finding Children with Unusual Growth Patterns
text: growthscreener package implements tools evaluate child growth respect Dutch criteria unusual growth. Application tools helps identify children meet criteria criteria referral youth health care (JGZ) follow-general physician paediatrician. current version implements Dutch guidelines height weight head circumference language development

code: hermanussencole(   hgtf,   hgtm,   sex,   rPP = 0.19,   rPO = 0.58,   mu = c(183.8, 170.7),   sigma = c(7.1, 6.3),   pmu = c(184, 170.6),   psigma = c(7.1, 6.5) )

title: Target Height Calculation Using the Hermanussen-Cole Method — hermanussencole
text: hgtf Numeric vector height biological father cm. hgtm Numeric vector height biological mother cm. length hgtm must hgtf. sex Character vector indicating sex child target height calculated. Must either "male" "female" length hgtf. rPP Numeric value correlation heights parents. default value (0.19) calculated Dutch population. Hermanussen & Cole (2003) used value 0.27. rPO Numeric value correlation parental height offspring height. default value (0.58) based Dutch population, Hermanussen & Cole (2003) used 0.57. mu Numeric vector length 2, representing mean height cm boys girls reference population. default values mu =   c(183.8, 170.7) come Fifth Dutch Growth Study (2009). sigma Numeric vector length 2, representing standard deviation height cm boys girls reference population. default values sigma = c(7.1, 6.3) based Fifth Dutch Growth Study (2009). pmu Numeric vector length 2, representing mean height cm fathers mothers reference population. default values pmu = c(184, 170.6) Fourth Dutch Growth Study (1997). psigma Numeric vector length 2, representing standard deviation height cm fathers mothers reference population. default values psigma = c(7.1, 6.5) Fourth Dutch Growth Study (1997).
